tag-1: Poland: CitiDirect EB — An Innovative Solution for Businesses
tag-2: Warsaw, Poland – Since April 2012, Citi Handlowy's corporate clients have been able to use CitiDirect Mobile, a mobile banking solution designed for large companies. In the second half of the year, the bank launched CitiDirect EB — a single-login financial services system. It is a comprehensive electronic banking solution takes makes it possible to use a single token-generated password to gain access both to the corporate account and to the CitiTrade Portal, a dedicated trade-financing module. This allows our corporate clients to take advantage of state-of-the-art technology to manage their funds with ease.
tag-3: CitiDirect EB offers real-time access to transaction data. The service has been greatly simplified and customized — the user is able to control both the layout of the main page and the scope of reports (the period covered, the accounts and companies included in the report).
tag-4: What's more is that CitiDirect EB is immediately available online, and there is no need to install any additional software. CitiDirect Mobile users can also access the service with their mobile devices by running a special application (available for Android, iOS, Blackberry, Windows Mobile and Symbian). Find out more about CitiDirect EB by watching our YouTube video.
tag-5: Katarzyna Bajerowska, head of Cash Management and Trade Financing Products, said: "The bank enjoys a strong position in the area of business and corporate solutions. Such a position takes many years to build. The key to success is listening to customer needs and delivering intuitive solutions. Thanks to innovations in technology combined with CitiGroup's global know-how, we have been able to design precisely such products, of which CitiDirect EB is a prime example."
tag-6: Magdalena Laskowska, head of Trade Financing at Citi Handlowy, said: "Our portfolio of factoring services is rich and much in demand. We went a step further in making it even more convenient for companies to finance their trading operations in this way by launching the CitiTrade Portal. This has made the process even simpler and faster. I am confident that our customers will appreciate this innovation."
tag-7: CitiDirect EB also supports liquidity management. A dedicated CitiTrade Portal module allows customers to settle their obligations under a reverse factoring system. What makes the bank's platform stand out against competing products is the ability to calculate the transaction costs before submitting the request. Another useful feature is a system of SMS alerts and notifications. Our bank is unique in the market in offering free unlimited alerts and notifications, allowing customers to define the types of events to monitor, as well as the timing and recipients (email, phone number).
tag-8: Having logged into the CitiTrade Portal, users should enter invoice data. This can be done either manually or by importing data from a file. Users can specify the format of the imported file. CitiTrade supports real-time monitoring of limits and costs associated with the request. Once funds have been made available, the platform provides in-depth feedback through current status notifications, customizable reports and alerts displayed on-line or delivered by email or SMS. Find out more by watching a video on the bank's YouTube.pl channel.
tag-9: For more information about the Bank's corporate offer, visit www.citihandlowy.pl
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citigroup provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-12: Citi Handlowy Citi Handlowy is one of the major financial institutions in Poland and offers, under the Citi Handlowy brand, a broad range of state-of-the-art products in corporate, investment and consumer banking. Through its modern distribution channels and a network of 96 branches, Bank Handlowy services over 20,000 corporate customers and over 900,000 individual ones. The Bank's group includes Dom Maklerski Citi Handlowy (brokerage house) and Handlowy Leasing. Being a member of Citi enables the customers of Bank Handlowy access to financial services provided in over 100 countries. Further information is available at www.citihandlowy.pl.
